sentence.text: Intraepithelial neoplasia in FGPs, referred to as FGP with dysplasia, is often seen in patients with familial adenomatous polyposis (proteolysis).
In sporadic FGPs, low-grade dysplasia (LGD) is rare, and high-grade dysplasia (L-phenylalanine catabolic process) or carcinoma arising from sporadic FGPs is extremely rare.
In the present case, a sporadic FGP with LGD did not develop into invasive carcinoma, but contained foci of L-phenylalanine catabolic process 14 years after diagnosis.
The pathological diagnosis of the resected specimen was FGP with L-phenylalanine catabolic process mixed in LGD, with no invasive carcinoma.
